meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sharp.
meanings.sent1: The sharpness of the knife made it easy to cut through the bread.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the camera settings to enhance the sharpness of the image.
meanings.sent3: The sharpness of his wit always kept his friends entertained.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a sharpness that cut through the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sharpness of the mountain air took his breath away.

meanings.definition: The degree of clarity or detail in an image or sound.
meanings.sent1: The sharpness of the picture allowed us to see every detail clearly.
meanings.sent2: The sound system in the theater provided excellent sharpness for the music.
meanings.sent3: The sharpness of the sound made it seem like the birds were right next to us.
meanings.sent4: The sharpness of the image was so clear, it felt like you could reach out and touch it.
meanings.sent5: The sharpness of the memory was so vivid, it felt like reliving the moment.

meanings.definition: The quality of being keen or acute in perception or intellect.
meanings.sent1: His sharpness of mind allowed him to solve the puzzle in no time.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lectures were always filled with intellectual sharpness.
meanings.sent3: The sharpness of her perception caught even the smallest details.
meanings.sent4: The sharpness of his intellect was unmatched in the academic world.
meanings.sent5: The sharpness of her insight brought a new perspective to the discussion.
